DOC.HEADLINE: HEAVY STORMS POUND EUROPE , KILLING 8
DOC.TEXT: Hurricane-force winds ripped_off roofs and toppled trees Friday , leaving five dead in Germany and one each in France , Switzerland and Belgium.Near-record tides pressured North_Sea dikes . The storm , called Lore , was the third to hit the Continent in six weeks . It knocked_out electricity in parts of Germany , Austria and France , stopped trains and caused highway pileups . The storm struck Thursday night , killing several motorists who crashed into fallen trees . By Friday afternoon , tides surged . The historic harbor at Hamburg , Germany ' s main North_Sea port , was flooded , but the city remained safe .
